title: (x) Leo Cabinets logo - Windsor, Textile, Arial {Yves, Mike Y}
content:
Hi friend somebody cna help id the font used in this logo  
Thanks

hernandomiguel

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [scan0003.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203104/http:/typophile.com/files/scan0003.jpg) | 100.08 KB |

 [‹ (x) Last Chants serif or sans? - Arbitrary Sans {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203104/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35976 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Desperate Housewives logo - Helvetica Ext, Bodoni {Jan E} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203104/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35965 "Go to next forum topic")
author: hernandomiguel

comments.content: There’s a number of fonts here — Cabinets is Windsor, the red sans is Arial, and the script is one of those horrible system fonts.
That was obviously done by a top-notch design firm. You had best duplicate it as closely as possible. So good luck with that.

The ’horrible system font’ script may be [’Textile’](http://web.archive.org/) from Apple (about the fifth one down the page).

- Mike Yanega
Case solved. Thank you Mike for refreshing my memory. :^)
If you don’t have one of those fonts, substitute Algerian. If you can get the same embossed bevel on it, it would be killer.
